intro: Chamaecrista rostrata, commonly known as the scarlet bird's-beak, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its unique, elongated seed pods give it the common name "bird's-beak." Chamaecrista rostrata is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
